steps.title: Understand how long a year is.
steps.content: Understand how long a year is. There are 1000 stardate units in one Earth year.

steps.title: Look at how long your year is.
steps.content: Look at how long your year is. 365 days normally, 366 for a leap year. This number is called n .

steps.title: Choose a base date.
steps.content: Choose a base date. The base date will determine all of your other calculations. There are two base dates that you can use: 2005 = 58000.00 and 2323 = 00000.00 The standard year (2005 or 2323) is now called b and the stardate year (58000.00 or 00000.00) is called c .

steps.title: Calculate the "month number".
steps.content: Calculate the "month number". This number shall be called m . Here's a list: January = 0; February = 31. For all other months, add one if it is a leap year. March = 59; April = 90; May = 120; June = 151; July = 181; August = 212; September = 243; October = 273; November = 304; December = 334.

steps.title: Find the day and year.
steps.content: Find the day and year. The day in the month is called d , and the year is called y . So, using 2005 as the base date, 23 May 2008 has these values: n = 366; b = 2005; c = 58000.00; m = 121 (120, +1 for leap year); d = 23; y = 2008.

steps.title: Put these values into the formula.
steps.content: Put these values into the formula. The stardate formula is this: c + (1000*(y-b)) + ((1000/n)*(m + d -1)) = Stardate. Using the above values, the stardate works out to be 61390.71. Stardates are usually quoted to two decimal places.

steps.title: Know the base date that has been used.
steps.content: Know the base date that has been used. As an example, lets look at the stardate from the last method, 61390.71. The base date is 2005 = 58000.00

steps.title: To calculate the year, look at the thousands (and above) digits.
steps.content: To calculate the year, look at the thousands (and above) digits. Ignore the hundreds and tens (and units and decimals). In this example, you get 61000.

steps.title: From this number, subtract the stardate base date, divide by 1000, and then add the common base date.
steps.content: From this number, subtract the stardate base date, divide by 1000, and then add the common base date. 61000-58000 = 3000. 3000/1000 = 3. 2005 + 3 = 2008. This is the year.

steps.title: Determine if it's a leap year.
steps.content: Determine if it's a leap year. A year that divides by four but not 100 is a leap year. A year that divides by four and 100 but not 400 is not a leap year. A year that divides by four, 100 and 400 (e.g. 2000) is a leap year. 2008 will divide by four but not 100, so it is a leap year.

steps.title: To calculate month and day, look at the hundreds digit, and the lower digits.
steps.content: To calculate month and day, look at the hundreds digit, and the lower digits. Ignore the thousands and anything higher. You get 390.71.

steps.title: Multiply by 365 (366 for leap years).
steps.content: Multiply by 365 (366 for leap years). When you multiply 390.71 by 366, you get 142,999.86.

steps.title: Divide by a thousand, then round to the nearest whole number.
steps.content: Divide by a thousand, then round to the nearest whole number. 142,999.86/1000 = 142.99986. Round up to 143.

steps.title: Determine the largest month number that can be subtracted from this number.
steps.content: Determine the largest month number that can be subtracted from this number. This number will be the month. Remember to add one to the month number if it's a leap year (and after February). The largest month number that goes into 144 is 121, so the month is May.

steps.title: Subtract the month number to get the date.
steps.content: Subtract the month number to get the date. 144-121 = 23. So your date is 23 May 2008. That's correct, it's the day you started with.
